w:r.w:t: [divorce caption]
FINAL DECREE OF DIVORCE
On ______ the Court heard this case.
Appearances

*[Petitioner, *{{______}}*, appeared [physically in the courtroom/by electronic method]*[ and announced ready]*. ]**[Petitioner's attorney of record, [name]*{{[name]}}*, appeared [physically in the courtroom/by electronic method] and announced ready.]**[Petitioner, *{{______}}*, did not appear but has agreed to the terms of this order as evidenced by Petitioner's signature below.]*

*[Respondent, *{{______}}*, appeared [physically in the courtroom/by electronic method]*[ and announced ready]*. ]**[Respondent's attorney of record, [name]*{{[name]}}*, appeared [physically in the courtroom/by electronic method] and announced ready.]**[ Respondent, *{{______}}*, although duly and properly cited, did not appear and wholly made default.]**[ Respondent, *{{______}}*, waived issuance and service of citation by waiver duly filed and did not otherwise appear.]**[ Respondent, *{{______}}*, has made a general appearance and has agreed to the terms of this judgment to the extent permitted by law, as evidenced by Respondent's signature below.]**[ Respondent, *{{______}}*, has made a general appearance and was duly notified but failed to appear and defaulted.]*

Also appearing was ______, appointed guardian ad litem of the child[ren] the subject of this suit. ______ appeared [physically in the courtroom/by electronic method].*[ The guardian ad litem has agreed to the terms of this order, as evidenced by the signature of the guardian ad litem below.]*
Also appearing was ______, appointed attorney ad litem of the child[ren] the subject of this suit. ______ appeared [physically in the courtroom/by electronic method].*[ The attorney
ad litem has agreed to the terms of this order, as evidenced by the signature of the guardian ad litem below.]*

Also appearing was ______, appointed by the Court as amicus attorney to assist the Court in protecting the best interests of the child[ren] the subject of this suit. ______ appeared [physically in the courtroom/by electronic method].*[ The amicus attorney has agreed to the terms of this order, as evidenced by the signature of the amicus attorney below.]*

Also appearing was ______, appointed attorney ad litem for *{{______}}*, who received process by substituted service but did not otherwise answer or appear. ______ appeared [physically in the courtroom/by electronic method].
Record
The making of a record of testimony was waived by the parties with the consent of the Court.
The record of testimony was duly reported by *[______, ______]**[the court reporter for ______]*.
Jurisdiction and Domicile

The Court finds that the pleadings of [Petitioner/Respondent] are in due form and contain all the allegations, information, and prerequisites required by law. The Court, after receiving evidence, finds that it has jurisdiction of this case and of all the parties and that *[at least sixty days have elapsed since the date the suit was filed]**[the requirements of section 6.702 of the Texas Family Code have been met]*.

The Court further finds that, at the time this suit was filed, *[[Petitioner/Respondent] had been a domiciliary of Texas for the preceding six-month period and a resident of the county in which this suit was filed for the preceding ninety-day period.]**[Petitioner was domiciled in

another state or nation and Respondent had been a domiciliary of Texas for the preceding six-month period and was a resident of this county in which the suit was filed.]* All persons entitled to citation were properly cited.
Jury
A jury was waived, and questions of fact and of law were submitted to the Court.
A jury was selected, questions of fact were submitted to the jury, and a verdict was returned and duly filed.
Agreement of Parties

The Court finds that the parties have entered into a written agreement as contained in this decree by virtue of having approved this decree as to both form and substance. To the extent permitted by law, the parties stipulate the agreement is enforceable as a contract. The Court approves the agreement of the parties as contained in this Final Decree of Divorce.

The Court finds that the parties have entered into an Agreement Incident to Divorce, in a document separate from this Final Decree of Divorce. The Court approves the agreement and incorporates it by reference as part of this decree as if it were recited herein verbatim and orders the parties to do all things necessary to effectuate the agreement. A copy of the agreement [is/is not] filed with the records of this Court.

The agreements in this Final Decree of Divorce were reached*[ in mediation with ______ on ______]**[ pursuant to the collaborative law process]**[ pursuant to the informal settlement process]*. This Final Decree of Divorce is stipulated to represent a merger of a *[mediated]**[collaborative law]**[informal]* settlement agreement dated ______ between the parties. To the extent there exist any differences between the *[mediated]**[collaborative law]**[informal]* settlement agreement and this Final Decree of Divorce, this Final Decree of
Divorce shall control in all instances.
The terms of this Final Decree of Divorce are in conformity with the parties' *[premarital]**[partition and exchange]* agreement.
Divorce
The Court finds that Petitioner and Respondent were married on ______.
IT IS ORDERED AND DECREED that *{{______}}*, Petitioner, and *{{______}}*, Respondent, are divorced and that the marriage between them is dissolved on the ground[s] of [grounds].
IT IS ORDERED AND DECREED that [Petitioner/Respondent], is granted a divorce from [Petitioner/Respondent], and the marriage between them is dissolved on the ground[s] of [grounds].
Child[ren] of the Marriage
The Court finds that there is no child of the marriage of Petitioner and Respondent and that none is expected.
The Court finds that there is no child of the marriage of Petitioner and Respondent now under eighteen years of age or otherwise entitled to support and that none is expected.
The Court finds that Petitioner and Respondent are the parents of the following child[ren]:

Sex:
Birth date:
Home state:
Social Security number:
Driver's license number and issuing state:
The Court finds no other children of the marriage are expected.
Parenting Plan

The Court finds that the provisions in [this decree/these orders] relating to [conservatorship/possession/support], and optimizing the development of a close and continuing relationship between each party and the child[ren]*[ constitute the parties' agreed parenting plan]**[ constitute the parenting plan established by the Court]*.
[Best Interest of the Child[ren]/Conservatorship]
The Court*[, having considered the circumstances of the parents and of the child[ren],]* finds that the following orders are in the best interest of the child[ren].
The following orders are for the safety and welfare and in the best interest of the following child[ren]:

IT IS ORDERED that *{{______}}* and *{{______}}* are appointed [Temporary]Joint Managing Conservators of the following child[ren]: [list of children's names]
IT IS ORDERED that [name] is appointed [Temporary]Sole Managing Conservator and [name] is appointed [Temporary]Possessory Conservator of the following child[ren]: [list of children's names]

IT IS ORDERED that *{{______}}* and *{{______}}* are removed as managing conservators and that *{{______}}* and *{{______}}* are appointed Joint Managing Conservators of the following child[ren]: [list of children's names]

IT IS ORDERED that *{{______}}* and *{{______}}* are removed as managing conservators and that [name] is appointed Sole Managing Conservator and [name] is appointed Possessory Conservator of the following child[ren]: [list of children's names]

IT IS ORDERED that, at all times, [name], as a [non]parent [temporary]joint managing conservator, shall have the following rights*[ as to [names] and that [name], as a [non]parent [temporary]joint managing conservator, shall have the following rights as to [names of children]]*:
the right to receive information from any other conservator of the child[ren] concerning the health, education, and welfare of the child[ren][punctuation]
the right to confer with the other [parent/conservator] to the extent possible before making a decision concerning the health, education, and welfare of the child[ren][punctuation]
the right of access to medical, dental, psychological, and educational records of the child[ren][punctuation]
the right to consult with a physician, dentist, or psychologist of the child[ren][punctuation]
the right to consult with school officials concerning the child[ren]'s welfare and educational status, including school activities[punctuation]
the right to attend school activities, including school lunches, performances, and field trips[punctuation]
the right to be designated on the child[ren]'s records as a person to be notified in case of an emergency[punctuation]
the right to consent to medical, dental, and surgical treatment during an emergency involving an immediate danger to the health and safety of the child[ren][punctuation]

the right to manage the estate[s] of the child[ren] to the extent the estate[s] [has/have] been created by the [parent/conservator]'s family or by the [parent/conservator], other than by the *[community or ]*joint property of the [parent/conservator][punctuation]

IT IS ORDERED that, at all times, [name], as a [non]parent [temporary]joint managing conservator, shall have the following rights*[ as to [names] and that [name], as a [non]parent [temporary]joint managing conservator, shall have the following rights as to [names of children]]*:
the right to receive information from any other conservator of the child[ren] concerning the health, education, and welfare of the child[ren][punctuation]
the right to confer with the other [parent/conservator] to the extent possible before making a decision concerning the health, education, and welfare of the child[ren][punctuation]
the right of access to medical, dental, psychological, and educational records of the child[ren][punctuation]
the right to consult with a physician, dentist, or psychologist of the child[ren][punctuation]
the right to consult with school officials concerning the child[ren]'s welfare and educational status, including school activities[punctuation]
the right to attend school activities, including school lunches, performances, and field trips[punctuation]
the right to be designated on the child[ren]'s records as a person to be notified in case of an emergency[punctuation]
the right to consent to medical, dental, and surgical treatment during an emergency involving an immediate danger to the health and safety of the child[ren][punctuation]

the right to manage the estate[s] of the child[ren] to the extent the estate[s] [has/have] been created by the [parent/conservator]'s family or by the [parent/conservator], other than by the *[community or ]*joint property of the [parent/conservator][punctuation]
IT IS ORDERED that, at all times, *{{______}}* and *{{______}}*, as [parent][temporary]joint managing conservators, shall each have the following duties:
the duty to inform the other conservator of the child[ren] in a timely manner of significant information concerning the health, education, and welfare of the child[ren];

the duty to inform the other conservator of the child[ren] if the conservator resides with for at least thirty days, marries, or intends to marry a person who the conservator knows is registered as a sex offender under chapter 62 of the Texas Code of Criminal Procedure or is currently charged with an offense for which on conviction the person would be required to register under that chapter. IT IS ORDERED that notice of this information shall be provided to the other conservator of the child[ren] as soon as practicable, but not later than the fortieth day after the date the conservator of the child[ren] begins to reside with the person or on the tenth day after the date the marriage occurs, as appropriate. IT IS ORDERED that the notice must include a description of the offense that is the basis of the person's requirement to register as a sex offender or of the offense with which the person is charged. WARNING: A CONSERVATOR COMMITS AN OFFENSE PUNISHABLE AS A CLASS C MISDEMEANOR IF THE CONSERVATOR FAILS TO PROVIDE THIS NOTICE;

the duty to inform the other conservator of the child[ren] if the conservator establishes a residence with a person who the conservator knows is the subject of a final protective order sought by an individual other than the conservator that is in effect on the date the residence with the person is established. IT IS ORDERED that notice of this information shall be provided to the other conservator of the child[ren] as soon as practicable, but not later than the thirtieth day after the date the conservator establishes residence with the person who is the subject of the final protective order. WARNING: A CONSERVATOR COMMITS AN OFFENSE PUNISHABLE AS A CLASS C MISDEMEANOR IF THE CONSERVATOR FAILS TO PROVIDE THIS NOTICE;

the duty to inform the other conservator of the child[ren] if the conservator resides with, or allows unsupervised access to a child by, a person who is the subject of a final protective order sought by the conservator after the expiration of sixty-day period following the date the final protective order is issued. IT IS ORDERED that notice of this information shall be provided to the other conservator of the child[ren] as soon as practicable, but not later than the ninetieth day after the date the final protective order was issued. WARNING: A CONSERVATOR COMMITS AN OFFENSE PUNISHABLE AS A CLASS C MISDEMEANOR IF THE CONSERVATOR FAILS TO PROVIDE THIS NOTICE; and

the duty to inform the other conservator of the child[ren] if the conservator is the subject of a final protective order issued after the date of the order establishing conservatorship. IT IS ORDERED that notice of this information shall be provided to the other conservator of the child[ren] as soon as practicable, but not later than the thirtieth day after the date the final protective order was issued. WARNING: A CONSERVATOR COMMITS AN OFFENSE PUNISHABLE AS A CLASS C MISDEMEANOR IF THE CONSERVATOR FAILS TO PROVIDE THIS NOTICE.

IT IS ORDERED that, during [his/her/their] periods of possession, [name], as [non]parent [temporary]joint managing conservator, shall have the following rights and duties*[ as to [names] and that [name], as a [non]parent [temporary]joint managing conservator, shall have the following rights and duties as to [names of children]]*:
the duty of care, control, protection, and reasonable discipline of the child[ren][punctuation]
the duty to support the child[ren], including providing the child[ren] with clothing, food, shelter, and medical and dental care not involving an invasive procedure[punctuation]
the right to consent for the child[ren] to medical and dental care not involving an invasive procedure[punctuation]
the right to direct the moral and religious training of the child[ren].

the [subject to agreement/independent/exclusive right] to represent the child[ren] in legal action and to make other decisions of substantial legal significance concerning the child[ren];

the [subject to agreement/exclusive right] to apply for[a] passport[s] for the child[ren], to renew the child[ren]'s passport[s], and to maintain possession of the child[ren]'s passport[s]; and

the [subject to agreement/independent/exclusive right] to manage the estate[s] of the child[ren] to the extent the estate[s] [has/have] been created by the*[ community or ]* joint property of the [parent/conservator].

except when a guardian of the child[ren]'s estate[s] or a guardian or attorney ad litem has been appointed for the child[ren], the right to act as an agent of the child[ren] in relation to the child[ren]'s estate[s] if the child[ren]'s action is required by a state, the United States, or a foreign government[punctuation]
the right to apply for [a]passport[ren] for the child[ren], to renew the child[ren]'s passport[ren], and to maintain possession of the child[ren]'s passport[ren][punctuation]

IT IS ORDERED that [name], as a nonparent [temporary]sole managing conservator, shall have the following rights and duties:
the right to have physical possession and to direct the moral and religious training of the child[ren];
the duty of care, control, protection, and reasonable discipline of the child[ren];
the duty to provide the child[ren] with clothing, food, shelter, education, and medical, psychological, and dental care;
the right to consent for the child[ren] to medical, psychiatric, psychological, dental, and surgical treatment and to have access to the child[ren]'s medical records;
the right to receive and give receipt for payments for the support of the child[ren] and to hold or disburse funds for the benefit of the child[ren];
except as provided by section 264.0111 of the Texas Family Code, the right to the services and earnings of the child[ren];
the right to consent to marriage and to enlistment in the armed forces of the United States;
the right to represent the child[ren] in legal action and to make other decisions of substantial legal significance concerning the child[ren];

except when a guardian of the child[ren]'s estate[s] or a guardian or attorney ad litem has been appointed for the child[ren], the right to act as an agent of the child[ren] in relation to the child[ren]'s estate[s] if the child[ren]'s action is required by a state, the United
States, or a foreign government;
the right to designate the primary residence of the child[ren][geographical area] and to make decisions regarding the child[ren]'s education;

if the parent-child relationship has been terminated with respect to the parents, or only living parent, or if there is no living parent, the right to consent to the adoption of the child[ren] and to make any other decision concerning the child[ren] that a parent could make;
the right to apply for [a]passport[ren] for the child[ren], to renew the child[ren]'s passport[ren], and to maintain possession of the child[ren]'s passport[ren];
the duty to inform the other conservator of the child[ren] in a timely manner of significant information concerning the health, education, and welfare of the child[ren];

the duty to inform the other conservator of the child[ren] if the conservator resides with for at least thirty days, marries, or intends to marry a person who the conservator knows is registered as a sex offender under chapter 62 of the Texas Code of Criminal Procedure or is currently charged with an offense for which on conviction the person would be required to register under that chapter. IT IS ORDERED that notice of this information shall be provided to the other conservator of the child[ren] as soon as practicable, but not later than the fortieth day after the date the conservator of the child[ren] begins to reside with the person or on the tenth day after the date the marriage occurs, as appropriate. IT IS ORDERED that the notice must include a description of the offense that is the basis of the person's requirement to register as a sex offender or of the offense with which the person is charged. WARNING: A CONSERVATOR COMMITS AN OFFENSE PUNISHABLE AS A CLASS C MISDEMEANOR IF THE CONSERVATOR FAILS TO PROVIDE THIS NOTICE;

the duty to inform the other conservator of the child[ren] if the conservator establishes a residence with a person who the conservator knows is the subject of a final protective order sought by an individual other than the conservator that is in effect on the date the residence with the person is established. IT IS ORDERED that notice of this information shall be provided to the other conservator of the child[ren] as soon as practicable, but not later than the thirtieth day after the date the conservator establishes residence with the person who is the subject of the final protective order. WARNING: A CONSERVATOR COMMITS AN OFFENSE PUNISHABLE AS A CLASS C MISDEMEANOR IF THE CONSERVATOR FAILS TO PROVIDE THIS NOTICE;

the duty to inform the other conservator of the child[ren] if the conservator resides with, or allows unsupervised access to a child by, a person who is the subject of a final protective order sought by the conservator after the expiration of the sixty-day period following the date the final protective order is issued. IT IS ORDERED that notice of this information shall be provided to the other conservator of the child[ren] as soon as practicable, but not later than the ninetieth day after the date the final protective order was issued. WARNING: A CONSERVATOR COMMITS AN OFFENSE PUNISHABLE AS A CLASS C MISDEMEANOR IF THE CONSERVATOR FAILS TO PROVIDE THIS NOTICE; and

the duty to inform the other conservator of the child[ren] if the conservator is the subject of a final protective order issued after the date of the order establishing conservatorship. IT IS ORDERED that notice of this information shall be provided to the other conservator of the child[ren] as soon as practicable, but not later than the thirtieth day after the date the final protective order was issued. WARNING: A CONSERVATOR COMMITS AN OFFENSE PUNISHABLE AS A CLASS C MISDEMEANOR IF THE CONSERVATOR FAILS TO PROVIDE THIS NOTICE.

IT IS ORDERED that [name] shall, each twelve months after the date of this order, file with the Court a report of facts concerning the child[ren]'s welfare, including the child[ren]'s whereabouts and physical condition.

the duty of care, control, protection, and reasonable discipline of the child[ren];
the duty to provide the child[ren] with clothing, food, and shelter; and
the right to consent to medical, dental, and surgical treatment during an emergency involving an immediate danger to the health and safety of the child[ren].
IT IS [FURTHER]ORDERED that [name], as a nonparent [temporary]possessory conservator, shall have the following right and duties at all times:
the right of access to medical, dental, psychological, and educational records of the child[ren] to the same extent as the managing conservator;
the duty to inform the other conservator of the child[ren] in a timely manner of significant information concerning the health, education, and welfare of the child[ren];

hand delivery by a person eighteen years of age or older either to the recipient or to a person who is eighteen years of age or older and permanently resides with the recipient;
delivery to the recipient by first-class mail or by certified mail, return receipt requested, to the recipient's last known mailing or residence address;

delivery to the recipient at the recipient's last known mailing or residence address using any person or entity whose principal business is that of a courier or deliverer of papers or documents either within or outside the United States;
delivery to the recipient at the recipient's electronic mail address as follows or to such other electronic mail address subsequently designated by the recipient:

delivery to the recipient at the recipient's mobile telephone number by text message as follows or to such other mobile telephone number subsequently designated by the recipient:

providing the document to the recipient by posting the document on the ______ Internet website program, in accordance with the provisions set form below in this order.

the duty to provide the child[ren] with clothing, food, and shelter; and

tenth day after the date the marriage occurs, as appropriate. IT IS ORDERED that the notice must include a description of the offense that is the basis of the person's requirement to register as a sex offender or of the offense with which the person is charged. Possession and Access
IT IS ORDERED that nothing in this order shall supersede any term of any protective order or condition of bond, probation, or parole.
Standard Possession Order

IT IS ORDERED that each conservator shall comply with all terms and conditions of this Standard Possession Order. IT IS ORDERED that this Standard Possession Order is effective immediately and applies to all periods of possession occurring on and after the date the Court signs this Standard Possession Order. IT IS, THEREFORE, ORDERED:
Definitions
In this Standard Possession Order "school" means the elementary
or secondary school in which the child is enrolled or, if the child is not enrolled in an elementary or secondary school, the public school district in which the child primarily resides.
In this Standard Possession Order "child" includes each child, whether one or more, who is a subject of this suit while that child is under the age of eighteen years and not otherwise emancipated.
Mutual Agreement or Specified Terms for Possession

IT IS ORDERED that the conservators shall have possession of the child at times mutually agreed to in advance by the parties, and, in the absence of mutual agreement, it is ORDERED that the conservators shall have possession of the child under the specified terms set out in this Standard Possession Order.
When [Parents/Conservators] Reside 50 Miles or Less Apart

Except as otherwise expressly provided in this Standard Possession Order, when [name] resides 50 miles or less from the primary residence of the child, [name] shall have the right to possession of the child as follows:
Weekends
On weekends that occur during the regular school term, beginning at [begin time <50], on the first, third, and fifth Friday of each month and ending at [end time <50].
On weekends that do not occur during the regular school term, beginning at 6:00 P.M., on the first, third, and fifth Friday of each month and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the following Sunday.
Weekend Possession Extended by a Holiday

Except as otherwise expressly provided in this Standard Possession Order, if a weekend period of possession by [name] begins on a student holiday or a teacher in-service day that falls on a Friday during the regular school term, as determined by the school in which the child is enrolled, or a federal, state, or local holiday that falls on a Friday during the summer months when school is not in session, that weekend period of possession shall begin at [begin time on weekend extended <50].

Except as otherwise expressly provided in this Standard Possession Order, if a weekend period of possession by [name] ends on or is immediately followed by a student holiday or a teacher in-service day that falls on a Monday during the regular school term, as determined by the school in which the child is enrolled, or a federal, state, or local holiday that falls on a Monday during the summer months
when school is not in session, that weekend period of possession shall end at [ending time on weekend extended by holiday < 50].
Thursdays - On Thursday of each week during the regular school term, beginning at [begin time Thursdays <50] and ending at [ending time Thursday <50].
Spring Vacation in Even-Numbered Years - In even-numbered years, beginning at [beginning time spring vaca\holidays<50] and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the day before school resumes after that vacation.
Extended Summer Possession by [name]

With Written Notice by April 1 - If [name] gives [name] written notice by April 1 of a year specifying an extended period or periods of summer possession for that year, [name] shall have possession of the child for thirty days beginning no earlier than the day after the child's school is dismissed for the summer vacation and ending no later than seven days before school resumes at the end of the summer vacation in that year, to be exercised in no more than two separate periods of at least seven consecutive days each, as specified in the written notice*[, provided that the period or periods of extended summer possession do not interfere with Father's Day possession]*. These periods of possession shall begin and end at 6:00 P.M. on each applicable day.

Without Written Notice by April 1 - If [name] does not give [name] written notice by April 1 of a year specifying an extended period or periods of summer possession for that year, [name] shall have possession of the child for thirty consecutive days in that year beginning at 6:00 P.M. on July 1 and ending at 6:00 P.M. on July 31.

Notwithstanding the Thursday periods of possession during the regular school term and the weekend periods of possession ORDERED for [name], it is expressly ORDERED that [name] shall have a superior right of possession of the child as follows:
Spring Vacation in Odd-Numbered Years - In odd-numbered years, beginning at [beginning time spring vaca\holidays<50] and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the day before school resumes after that vacation.

Summer Weekend Possession by [name] - If [name] gives [name] written notice by April 15 of a year, [name] shall have possession of the child on any one weekend beginning at 6:00 P.M. on Friday and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the following Sunday during any one period of the extended summer possession by [name] in that year, provided that [name] picks up the child from [name] and returns the child to that same place*[ and that the weekend so designated does not interfere with Father's Day possession]*. Not later than the fifteenth day before
the Friday that begins the designated weekend, [name] must give [name] written notice of the location at which [name] is to pick up and return the child.

Extended Summer Possession by [name] - If [name] gives [name] written notice by April 15 of a year or gives [name] fourteen days' written notice on or after April 16 of a year, [name] may designate one weekend beginning no earlier than the day after the child's school is dismissed for the summer vacation and ending no later than seven days before school resumes at the end of the summer vacation, during which an otherwise scheduled weekend period of possession by [name] shall not take place in that year, provided that the weekend so designated does not interfere with [name]'s period or periods of extended summer possession*[ or with Father's Day possession]*.
Notwithstanding the weekend and Thursday periods of possession of [name], [name] and [name] shall have the right to possession of the child as follows:

Christmas Holidays in Even-Numbered Years - In even-numbered years, [name] shall have the right to possession of the child beginning at [beginning time spring vaca\holidays<50] for the Christmas school vacation and ending at noon on December 28, and [name] shall have the right to possession of the child beginning at noon on December 28 and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the day before school resumes after that Christmas school vacation.

Christmas Holidays in Odd-Numbered Years - In odd-numbered years, [name] shall have the right to possession of the child beginning at [beginning time spring vaca\holidays<50] for the Christmas school vacation and ending at noon on December 28, and [name] shall have the right to possession of the child beginning at noon on December 28 and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the day before school resumes after that Christmas school vacation.

Thanksgiving in Odd-Numbered Years - In odd-numbered years, [name] shall have the right to possession of the child beginning at [beginning time spring vaca\holidays<50] before Thanksgiving and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the Sunday following Thanksgiving.

Thanksgiving in Even-Numbered Years - In even-numbered years, [name] shall have the right to possession of the child beginning at [beginning time spring vaca\holidays<50] before Thanksgiving and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the Sunday following Thanksgiving.

Child's Birthday - If a [parent/conservator] is not otherwise entitled under this Standard Possession Order to present possession of [a/the] child on the child's birthday, that [parent/conservator] shall have possession of the child*[ and the child's minor siblings]* beginning at 6:00 P.M. and ending at 8:00 P.M. on that day, provided that that [parent/conservator] picks up the child[ren] from the
other [parent/conservator]'s residence and returns the child[ren] to that same place.

Father's Day - [name] shall have the right to possession of the child each year, beginning at 6:00 P.M. on the Friday preceding Father's Day and ending at [end time Father's Day <50], provided that if [name] is not otherwise entitled under this Standard Possession Order to present possession of the child, he shall pick up the child from [name]'s residence and return the child to that same place.
Father's Day - ______

Father's Day in Even-Numbered Years - In even-numbered years, [name] shall have the right to possession of the child beginning at 6:00 P.M. on the Friday preceding Father's Day and ending at [end time Father's Day <50], provided that if [name] is not otherwise entitled under this Standard Possession Order to present possession of the child, he shall pick up the child from [name]'s residence and return the child to that same place.

Father's Day in Odd-Numbered Years - In odd-numbered years, [name] shall have the right to possession of the child beginning at 6:00 P.M. on the Friday preceding Father's Day and ending at [end time Father's Day <50], provided that if [name] is not otherwise entitled under this Standard Possession Order to present possession of the child, he shall pick up the child from [name]'s residence and return the child to that same place.

Father's Day in Even-Numbered Years - In even-numbered years, [name] shall have the right to possession of the child beginning at 6:00 P.M. on the Friday preceding Father's Day and ending at [end time Father's Day <50], provided that if [name] is not otherwise entitled under this Standard Possession Order to present possession of the child, he shall pick up the child from [name]'s residence and return the child to that same place.

Father's Day in Odd-Numbered Years - In odd-numbered years, [name] shall have the right to possession of the child beginning at 6:00 P.M. on the Friday preceding Father's Day and ending at [end time Father's Day <50], provided that if [name] is not otherwise entitled under this Standard Possession Order to present possession of the child, he shall pick up the child from [name]'s residence and return the child to that same place.

Mother's Day in Even-Numbered Years - In even-numbered years, [name] shall have the right to possession of the child beginning at [begin time <50] on the Friday preceding Mother's Day and ending at [end time Mother's Day <50], provided that if [name] is not otherwise entitled under this Standard Possession Order to present possession of the child, he shall pick up the child from [name]'s residence and return the child to that same place.

Mother's Day in Odd-Numbered Years In odd-numbered years, [name] shall have the right to possession of the child beginning at [begin time <50] on the Friday preceding Mother's Day and ending at [end time Mother's Day <50], provided that if [name] is not otherwise entitled under this Standard Possession Order to present possession of the child, he shall pick up the child from [name]'s residence and return the child to that same place.

Mother's Day - [name] shall have the right to possession of the child each year, beginning at [begin time <50] on the Friday preceding Mother's Day and ending at [end time Mother's Day <50], provided that if [name] is not otherwise entitled under this Standard Possession Order to present possession of the child, she shall pick up the child from [name]'s residence and return the child to that same place.
Mother's Day - ______

Mother's Day in Even-Numbered Years - In even-numbered years, [name] shall have the right to possession of the child beginning at [begin time <50] on the Friday preceding Mother's Day and ending at [end time Mother's Day <50], provided that if [name] is not otherwise entitled under this Standard Possession Order to present possession of the child, she shall pick up the child from [name]'s residence and return the child to that same place.

Mother's Day in Odd-Numbered Years In odd-numbered years, [name] shall have the right to possession of the child beginning at [begin time <50] on the Friday preceding Mother's Day and ending at [end time Mother's Day <50], provided that if [name] is not otherwise entitled under this Standard Possession Order to present possession of the child, she shall pick up the child from [name]'s residence and return the child to that same place.

Father's Day in Even-Numbered Years - In even-numbered years, [name] shall have the right to possession of the child beginning at 6:00 P.M. on the Friday preceding Father's Day and ending at [end time Father's Day <50], provided that if [name] is not otherwise entitled under this Standard Possession Order to present possession of the child, he shall pick up the child from [name]'s residence and return the child to that same place.

Father's Day in Odd-Numbered Years - In odd-numbered years, [name] shall have the right to possession of the child beginning at 6:00 P.M. on the Friday preceding Father's Day and ending at [end time Father's Day <50], provided that if [name] is not otherwise entitled under this Standard Possession Order to present possession of the child, he shall pick up the child from [name]'s residence and return the child to that same place.
Mother's Day in Even-Numbered Years - In even-numbered years,

[name] shall have the right to possession of the child beginning at [begin time <50] on the Friday preceding Mother's Day and ending at [end time Mother's Day <50], provided that if [name] is not otherwise entitled under this Standard Possession Order to present possession of the child, he shall pick up the child from [name]'s residence and return the child to that same place.

Mother's Day in Odd-Numbered Years In odd-numbered years, [name] shall have the right to possession of the child beginning at [begin time <50] on the Friday preceding Mother's Day and ending at [end time Mother's Day <50], provided that if [name] is not otherwise entitled under this Standard Possession Order to present possession of the child, he shall pick up the child from [name]'s residence and return the child to that same place.
When [Parents/Conservators] Reside *[More than 50 Miles but ]*100 Miles or Less Apart

Except as otherwise expressly provided in this Standard Possession Order, when [name] resides *[more than 50 Miles but ]*100 miles or less from the primary residence of the child, [name] shall have the right to possession of the child as follows:
Weekends
On weekends that occur during the regular school term, beginning at [time], on the first, third, and fifth Friday of each month and ending at [time].
On weekends that do not occur during the regular school term, beginning at 6:00 P.M., on the first, third, and fifth Friday of each month and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the following Sunday.
Weekend Possession Extended by a Holiday

Except as otherwise expressly provided in this Standard Possession Order, if a weekend period of possession by [name] begins on a student holiday or a teacher in-service day that falls on a Friday during the regular school term, as determined by the school in which the child is enrolled, or a federal, state, or local holiday that falls on a Friday during the summer months when school is not in session, that weekend period of possession shall begin at [begin time on weekends extended].

Except as otherwise expressly provided in this Standard Possession Order, if a weekend period of possession by [name] ends on or is immediately followed by a student holiday or a teacher in-service day that falls on a Monday during the regular school term, as determined by the school in which the child is enrolled, that weekend period of possession shall end at [ending time on weekend extended by holiday].

Except as otherwise expressly provided in this Standard Possession Order, if a weekend period of possession by [name] ends on or is immediately followed by a federal, state, or local holiday that falls on a Monday during the summer months when school is not in session, that weekend period of possession shall end at 6:00 P.M. on that Monday.
Thursdays - On Thursday of each week during the regular school term, beginning at [beginning time] and ending at [ending time].

Spring Vacation in Even-Numbered Years - In even-numbered years, beginning at [beginning time] for the school's spring vacation and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the day before school resumes after that vacation.
Extended Summer Possession by [name]

With Written Notice by April 1 - If [name] gives [name] written notice by April 1 of a year specifying an extended period or periods of summer possession for that year, [name] shall have possession of the child for thirty days beginning no earlier than the day after the child's school is dismissed for the summer vacation and ending no later than seven days before school resumes at the end of the summer vacation in that year, to be exercised in no more than two separate periods of at least seven consecutive days each, as specified in the written notice*[, provided that the period or periods of extended summer possession do not interfere with Father's Day possession]*. These periods of possession shall begin and end at 6:00 P.M. on each applicable day.

Without Written Notice by April 1 - If [name] does not give [name] written notice by April 1 of a year specifying an extended period or periods of summer possession for that year, [name] shall have possession of the child for thirty consecutive days in that year beginning at 6:00 P.M. on July 1 and ending at 6:00 P.M. on July 31.

Notwithstanding the Thursday periods of possession during the regular school term and the weekend periods of possession ORDERED for [name], it is expressly ORDERED that [name] shall have a superior right of possession of the child as follows:

Spring Vacation in Odd-Numbered Years - In odd-numbered years, beginning at [beginning time] for the school's spring vacation and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the day before school resumes after that vacation.

Summer Weekend Possession by [name] - If [name] gives [name] written notice by April 15 of a year, [name] shall have possession of the child on any one weekend beginning at 6:00 P.M. on Friday and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the following Sunday during any one period of the extended summer possession

by [name] in that year, provided that [name] picks up the child from [name] and returns the child to that same place*[ and that the weekend so designated does not interfere with Father's Day possession]*. Not later than the fifteenth day before the Friday that begins the designated weekend, [name] must give [name] written notice of the location at which [name] is to pick up and return the child.

Extended Summer Possession by [name] - If [name] gives [name] written notice by April 15 of a year or gives [name] fourteen days' written notice on or after April 16 of a year, [name] may designate one weekend beginning no earlier than the day after the child's school is dismissed for the summer vacation and ending no later than seven days before school resumes at the end of the summer vacation, during which an otherwise scheduled weekend period of possession by [name] shall not take place in that year, provided that the weekend so designated does not interfere with [name]'s period or periods of extended summer possession*[ or with Father's Day possession]*.
[Parents/Conservators] Who Reside More Than 100 Miles Apart

Except as otherwise expressly provided in this Standard Possession Order, when [name] resides more than 100 miles from the residence of the child, [name] shall have the right to possession of the child as follows:

Weekends - Unless [name] elects the alternative period of weekend possession described in the next paragraph, [name] shall have the right to possession of the child on weekends beginning at 6:00 P.M., on the first, third, and fifth Friday of each month and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the following Sunday.

Alternate Weekend Possession - In lieu of the weekend possession described in the foregoing paragraph, [name] shall have the right to possession of the child not more than one weekend per month of [name]'s choice beginning at 6:00 P.M. on the day school recesses for the weekend and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the day before school resumes after the weekend. [name] may elect an option for this alternative period of weekend possession by giving written notice to [name] within ninety days after the parties begin to reside more than 100 miles apart. If [name] makes this election, [name] shall give [name] fourteen days' written or telephonic notice preceding a designated weekend. The weekends chosen shall not conflict with the provisions regarding Christmas, Thanksgiving[,/, and] the child's birthday[Mother's Day/Father's Day possession] below.
Weekends - On weekends beginning at 6:00 P.M. on the first, third, and fifth Friday of each month, and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the following Sunday.

Weekend - One weekend per month, of [name]'s choice, beginning at 6:00 P.M. on the day school recesses for the weekend and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the day before school resumes after the weekend, provided that [name] gives

[name] fourteen days' written or telephonic notice preceding a designated weekend. The weekends chosen shall not conflict with the provisions regarding Christmas, Thanksgiving[,/, and] the child's birthday[Mother's Day/Father's Day possession] below.
Weekend Possession Extended by a Holiday

Except as otherwise expressly provided in this Standard Possession Order, if a weekend period of possession by [name] begins on a student holiday or a teacher in-service day that falls on a Friday during the regular school term, as determined by the school in which the child is enrolled, or a federal, state, or local holiday during the summer months when school is not in session, that weekend period of possession shall begin at [begin time on weekends extended]

Except as otherwise expressly provided in this Standard Possession Order, if a weekend period of possession by [name] ends on or is immediately followed by a student holiday or a teacher in-service day that falls on a Monday during the regular school term, as determined by the school in which the child is enrolled, that weekend period of possession shall end at [ending time on weekend extended by holiday].

Except as otherwise expressly provided in this Standard Possession Order, if a weekend period of possession by [name] ends on or is immediately followed by a federal, state, or local holiday that falls on a Monday during the summer months when school is not in session, that weekend period of possession shall end at 6:00 P.M. on that Monday.

Spring Vacation in All Years - Every year, beginning at 6:00 P.M. on the day the child is dismissed from school for the school's spring vacation and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the day before school resumes after that vacation.
Extended Summer Possession by [name]

With Written Notice by April 1 - If [name] gives [name] written notice by April 1 of a year specifying an extended period or periods of summer possession for that year, [name] shall have possession of the child for forty-two days beginning no earlier than the day after the child's school is dismissed for the summer vacation and ending no later than seven days before school resumes at the end of the summer vacation in that year, to be exercised in no more than two separate periods of at least seven consecutive days each, as specified in the written notice*[, provided that the period or periods of extended summer possession do not interfere with Father's Day possession]*. These periods of possession shall begin and end at 6:00 P.M. on each applicable day.
Without Written Notice by April 1 - If [name] does not give [name] written notice by April 1 of a year specifying an extended period or periods of
summer possession for that year, [name] shall have possession of the child for forty-two consecutive days beginning at 6:00 P.M. on June 15 and ending at 6:00 P.M. on July 27 of that year.
Notwithstanding the weekend periods of possession ORDERED for [name], it is expressly ORDERED that [name] shall have a superior right of possession of the child as follows:

Summer Weekend Possession by [name] - If [name] gives [name] written notice by April 15 of a year, [name] shall have possession of the child on any one weekend beginning at 6:00 P.M. on Friday and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the following Sunday during any one period of possession by [name] during [name]'s extended summer possession in that year, provided that if a period of possession by [name] in that year exceeds thirty days, [name] may have possession of the child under the terms of this provision on any two nonconsecutive weekends during that period and provided that [name] picks up the child from [name] and returns the child to that same place*[ and that the weekend so designated does not interfere with Father's Day possession]*.

Extended Summer Possession by [name] - If [name] gives [name] written notice by April 15 of a year, [name] may designate twenty-one days beginning no earlier than the day after the child's school is dismissed for the summer vacation and ending no later than seven days before school resumes at the end of the summer vacation in that year, to be exercised in no more than two separate periods of at least seven consecutive days each, during which [name] shall not have possession of the child, provided that the period or periods so designated do not interfere with [name]'s period or periods of extended summer possession*[ or with Father's Day possession]*. These periods of possession shall begin and end at 6:00 P.M. on each applicable day.

General Terms and Conditions

Except as otherwise expressly provided in this Standard Possession Order, the terms and conditions of possession of the child that apply regardless of the distance between the residence of a [parent/conservator] and the child are as follows:
Surrender of Child by [name] - [name] is ORDERED to surrender the child to [name] at the beginning of each period of [name]'s possession at the residence of [name].

If a period of possession by [name] begins at the time the child's school is regularly dismissed, [name] is ORDERED to surrender the child to [name] at the beginning of each such period of possession at the school in which the child is enrolled. If the child is not physically attending school, [name] shall pick up the child at the residence of [name] at 6:00 P.M., and [name] is ORDERED to surrender the child to [name] at the residence of [name] at 6:00 P.M. under these circumstances.
Surrender of Child by [name] - [name] is ORDERED to surrender the child to [name] at the residence of [name] at the end of each period of possession.

Return of Child by [name] - [name] is ORDERED to return the child to the residence of [name] at the end of each period of possession. However, it is ORDERED that, if [name] and [name] live in the same county at the time of rendition of this order, [name]'s county of residence remains the same after rendition of this order, and [name]'s county of residence changes, effective on the date of the change of residence by [name], [name] shall surrender the child to [name] at the residence of [name] at the end of each period of possession.

If a period of possession by [name] ends at the time the child's school resumes, [name] is ORDERED to surrender the child to [name] at the end of each such period of possession at the school in which the child is enrolled or, if the child is not physically attending school, at the residence of [name] at 6:00 P.M.

Surrender of Child by [name] - [name] is ORDERED to surrender the child to [name], if the child is in [name]'s possession or subject to [name]'s control, at the beginning of each period of [name]'s exclusive periods of possession, at the place designated in this Standard Possession Order.

Return of Child by [name] - [name] is ORDERED to return the child to [name], if [name] is entitled to possession of the child, at the end of each of [name]'s exclusive periods of possession, at the place designated in this Standard Possession Order.
Personal Effects - Each conservator is ORDERED to return with the child the personal effects that the child brought at the beginning of the period of possession.

Designation of Competent Adult - Each conservator may designate any competent adult to pick up and return the child, as applicable. IT IS ORDERED that a conservator or a designated competent adult be present when the child is picked up or returned.
Inability to Exercise Possession - Each conservator is ORDERED
to give notice to the person in possession of the child on each occasion that the conservator will be unable to exercise that conservator's right of possession for any specified period.

Written Notice - Written notice, including notice provided by electronic mail or facsimile or as otherwise authorized in this [decree/order], shall be deemed to have been timely made if received or, if applicable, postmarked before or at the time that notice is due. Each conservator is ORDERED to notify the other conservator of any change in the conservator's electronic mail address or facsimile number within twenty-four hours after the change.

Notice to School and Other Conservator - If a conservator's time of possession of the child ends at the time school resumes and for any reason the child is not or will not be returned to school, the conservator in possession of the child shall immediately notify the school and the other conservator that the child will not be or has not been returned to school.
This concludes the Standard Possession Order.
Possession Order
IT IS ORDERED that nothing in this order shall supersede any term of any protective order or condition of bond, probation, or parole.

IT IS ORDERED that each party shall comply with all terms and conditions of this Possession Order. IT IS ORDERED that this Possession Order is effective immediately and applies to all periods of possession occurring on and after the date the Court signs this Possession Order. IT IS THEREFORE ORDERED:
Definition

In this order "school" means the elementary or secondary school in which a child is enrolled or, if a child is not enrolled in an elementary or secondary school, the public school district in which the child primarily resides.
Mutual Agreement or Specified Terms for Possession

IT IS ORDERED that [name] shall have possession of [names] at all times not specifically set aside for [name] and as set out elsewhere in this order. IT IS ORDERED that [name] shall have possession of [names] at all times not specifically set aside for [name] and as set out elsewhere in this order. IT IS ORDERED that each [parent/conservator] shall have possession of the children at any and all times mutually agreed to in advance by the parties and, in the absence of mutual agreement, IT IS ORDERED that each party, beginning immediately on the signing of this order, shall have possession of the children under the specified terms set out in this order. IT IS THEREFORE ORDERED:
Periods of Possession
Except as otherwise expressly provided in this order, each party shall have the right to possession of the children as follows:
Weekends

On weekends that occur during the regular school term, [name] shall have possession of the children beginning at [time] on the first and third Friday of each month and ending at [time], and [name] shall have possession of the children beginning at [time] on the second and fourth Friday of each month and ending at [time].

On weekends that do not occur during the regular school term, [name] shall have possession of the children beginning at 6:00 P.M. on the first and third Friday of each month and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the following Sunday, and [name] shall have possession of the children beginning at 6:00 P.M. on the second and fourth Friday of each month and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the following Sunday.

In each month containing five Fridays, on weekends that occur during the regular school term, [name] shall have possession of [names] beginning at [time] on the fifth Friday and ending at [time]. In each month containing five Fridays, [name] shall have possession of [names] beginning at [time] on the fifth Friday and ending at [time].

In each month containing five Fridays, on weekends that do not occur during the regular school term, [name] shall have possession of [names] beginning at 6:00 P.M. on the fifth Friday and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the following Sunday. In each month containing five Fridays, [name] shall have possession of [names] beginning at 6:00 P.M. on the fifth Friday and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the following Sunday.

Weekend Possession Extended by a Student Holiday or Teacher In-Service Day - Except as otherwise expressly provided in this order, if a weekend period of possession by a [parent/conservator] begins on a student holiday or a teacher in-service day that falls on a Friday during the regular school term, as determined by the school in which the children are enrolled, that weekend period of possession shall begin at [time] on the immediately preceding Thursday.

Except as otherwise expressly provided in this order, if a weekend period of possession by a [parent/conservator] ends on or is immediately followed by a student holiday or a teacher in-service day that falls on a Monday during the regular school term, as determined by the school in which the children are enrolled, that weekend period of possession shall end at [ending time on weekend extended by holiday].

Weekend Possession Extended by a Summer Holiday - Except as otherwise expressly provided in this order, if a weekend period of possession by a [parent/conservator] begins on a federal, state, or local holiday that falls on a Friday
during the summer months when school is not in session, that weekend period of possession shall begin at 6:00 P.M. on the immediately preceding Thursday.

Except as otherwise expressly provided in this order, if a weekend period of possession by a [parent/conservator] ends on or is immediately followed by a federal, state, or local holiday that falls on a Monday during the summer months when school is not in session, that weekend period of possession shall end at 6:00 P.M. on that Monday.
Wednesdays - [name] shall have possession of the children on Wednesday of each week during the regular school term, beginning at [beginning time] and ending at [time].
Thursdays - [name] shall have possession of the children on Thursday of each week during the regular school term, beginning at [beginning time] and ending at [ending time].
Notwithstanding the weekend, Wednesday, and Thursday periods of possession provided above, [name] and [name] shall have the right to possession of the children as follows:

First Part of Christmas Holidays - [name] shall have possession of the children in even-numbered years, beginning at [beginning time] for the Christmas school vacation and ending at noon on December 28. [name] shall have possession of the children in odd-numbered years, beginning at [beginning time] on the day the children are dismissed from school for the Christmas school vacation and ending at noon on December 28.

Last Part of Christmas Holidays - [name] shall have possession of the children in odd-numbered years, beginning at noon on December 28 and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the day before school resumes after that Christmas school vacation. [name] shall have possession of the children in even-numbered years, beginning at noon on December 28 and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the day before school resumes after that Christmas school vacation.

Thanksgiving - [name] shall have possession of the children in odd-numbered years, beginning at [beginning time] before Thanksgiving and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the Sunday following Thanksgiving. [name] shall have possession of the children in even-numbered years, beginning at [beginning time] on the day the children are dismissed from school before Thanksgiving and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the Sunday following Thanksgiving.

Spring Vacation - [name] shall have possession of the children in even-numbered years, beginning at [beginning time] for the school's spring vacation and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the day before the children's school resumes after that vacation. [name] shall have possession of the children in odd-numbered years, beginning at
[beginning time] for the school's spring vacation and ending at 6:00 P.M. on the day before the children's school resumes after that vacation.

Father's Day in Even-Numbered Years - In even-numbered years, [name] shall have possession of the children for Father's Day, beginning at 6:00 P.M. on the Friday preceding Father's Day and ending at [time], provided that if [name] is not otherwise entitled under this order to present possession of the children, she shall pick up the child from [name]'s residence and return the children to that same place.

Father's Day in Odd-Numbered Years - In odd-numbered years, [name] shall have possession of the children for Father's Day, beginning at 6:00 P.M. on the Friday preceding Father's Day and ending at [time], provided that if [name] is not otherwise entitled under this order to present possession of the children, she shall pick up the children from [name]'s residence and return the child to that same place.

Mother's Day in Even-Numbered Years - In even-numbered years, [name] shall have possession of the children for Mother's Day, beginning at [time] on the Friday preceding Mother's Day and ending at [time], provided that if [name] is not otherwise entitled under this order to present possession of the children, she shall pick up the children from [name]'s residence and return the children to that same place.

Mother's Day in Odd-Numbered Years In odd-numbered years, [name] shall have possession of the children for Mother's Day, beginning at [time] on the Friday preceding Mother's Day and ending at [time], provided that if [name] is not otherwise entitled under this order to present possession of the children, she shall pick up the children from [name]'s residence and return the children to that same place.
Extended Summer Possession
In even-numbered years, [name] shall have possession of the children for thirty days ______. This period of possession shall begin and end at 6:00 P.M.
In even-numbered years, [name] shall have possession of the children for thirty days ______. This period of possession shall begin and end at 6:00 P.M.
In odd-numbered years, [name] shall have possession of the children for thirty days ______. This period of possession shall begin and end at 6:00 P.M.
In odd-numbered years, [name] shall have possession of the children for thirty days ______. This period of possession shall begin and end at 6:00 P.M.
Extended Summer Possession in Even-Numbered Years

With Written Notice by [name] by April 1 - In even-numbered years, if [name] gives [name] written notice by April 1 of a year specifying an extended period or periods of summer possession for that year, [name] shall have possession of the children for twenty-one days beginning no earlier than the day after the children's school is dismissed for the summer vacation and ending no later than twenty-eight days before school resumes at the end of the summer vacation in that year, to be exercised in no more than two separate periods of at least seven consecutive days each, as specified in the written notice*[, provided that the period or periods of extended summer possession do not interfere with Father's Day possession]*. These periods of possession shall begin and end at 6:00 P.M.

Without Written Notice by [name] by April 1 - In even-numbered years, if [name] does not give [name] written notice by April 1 of that year specifying an extended period or periods of summer possession for that year, [name] shall have possession of the children for twenty-one consecutive days in that year beginning at 6:00 P.M. on June 22 and ending at 6:00 P.M. on July 13.

With Written Notice by [name] by May 1 - In even-numbered years, if [name] gives [name] written notice by May 1 of a year specifying an extended period or periods of summer possession for that year, [name] shall have possession of the children for twenty-one days beginning no earlier than the day after the children's school is dismissed for the summer vacation and ending no later than seven days before school resumes at the end of the summer vacation in that year, to be exercised in no more than two separate periods of at least seven consecutive days each, as specified in the written notice,

provided that the period or periods do not conflict with the period or periods of extended summer possession by [name] for that year*[ or with Father's Day possession]*. These periods of possession shall begin and end at 6:00 P.M.

Without Written Notice by [name] by May 1 - In even-numbered years, if [name] does not give [name] written notice by May 1 of that year specifying an extended period or periods of summer possession for that year, [name] shall have possession of the children for twenty-one consecutive days in that year beginning at 6:00 P.M. on July 13 and ending at 6:00 P.M. on August 3. If [name] has designated days within this twenty-one-day period as part of [name]'s period or periods of extended summer possession of the children, [name]'s extended period of summer possession shall begin at 6:00 P.M. on the last day designated by [name] and shall end at 6:00 P.M. twenty-one days later.
Extended Summer Possession in Odd-Numbered Years

With Written Notice by [name] by April 1 - In odd-numbered years, if [name] gives [name] written notice by April 1 of a year specifying an extended period or periods of summer possession for that year, [name] shall have possession of the children for twenty-one days beginning no earlier than the day after the children's school is dismissed for the summer vacation and ending no later than twenty-eight days before school resumes at the end of the summer vacation in that year, to be exercised in no more than two separate periods of at least seven consecutive days each, as specified in the written notice*[, provided that the period or periods of extended summer possession do not interfere with Father's Day possession]*. These periods of possession shall begin and end at 6:00 P.M.

Without Written Notice by [name] by April 1 - In odd-numbered years, if [name] does not give [name] written notice by April 1 of that year specifying an extended period or periods of summer possession for that year, [name] shall have possession of the children for twenty-one consecutive days in that year beginning at 6:00 P.M. on June 22 and ending at 6:00 P.M. on July 13.

With Written Notice by [name] by May 1 - In odd-numbered years, if [name] gives [name] written notice by May 1 of a year specifying an extended period or periods of summer possession for that year, [name] shall have possession of the children for twenty-one days beginning no earlier than the day after the children's school is dismissed for the summer vacation and ending no later than seven days before school resumes at the end of the summer vacation in that year, to be exercised in no more than two separate periods of at least seven consecutive days each, as specified in the written notice, provided that the period or periods do not conflict with the period or periods of extended summer possession by [name] for that year*[ or with Father's Day possession]*. These periods of possession shall begin and end at 6:00 P.M.

Without Written Notice by [name] by May 1 - In odd-numbered years, if [name] does not give [name] written notice by May 1 of that year specifying an extended period or periods of summer possession for that year, [name] shall have possession of the

children for twenty-one consecutive days in that year beginning at 6:00 P.M. on July 13 and ending at 6:00 P.M. on August 3. If [name] has designated days within this twenty-one-day period as part of [name]'s period or periods of extended summer possession of the children, [name]'s extended period of summer possession shall begin at 6:00 P.M. on the last day designated by [name] and shall end at 6:00 P.M. twenty-one days later.
General Terms and Conditions
Except as otherwise expressly provided in this order, IT IS ORDERED[AND DECREED] that the terms and conditions of possession of the children are as follows:

Surrender of [names] by [name] - [name] is ORDERED to surrender [names] to [name] at the beginning of each period of [name]'s possession at the residence of [name].*[ If a period of possession by [name] begins at the time the child[ren]'s school is regularly dismissed, [name] is ORDERED to surrender [names] to [name] at the beginning of each such period of possession at the school in which the child[ren] [is/are] enrolled, and [name] is ORDERED to pick up [names] at the child[ren]'s school at the time the child[ren]'s school is regularly dismissed. If the child[ren] [is/are] not in school, [name] shall pick up the child[ren] at the residence of [name] at 6:00 P.M., and [name] is ORDERED to surrender [names] to [name] at the residence of [name] at 6:00 P.M. under these circumstances.]*

Surrender of [names] by [name] - [name] is ORDERED to surrender [names] to [name] at the beginning of each period of [name]'s possession at the residence of [name].*[ If a period of possession by [name] begins at the time the child[ren]'s school is regularly dismissed, [name] is ORDERED to surrender [names] to [name] at the beginning of each such period of possession at the school in which the child[ren] [is/are] enrolled, and [name] is ORDERED to pick up [names] at the child[ren]'s school at the time the child[ren]'s school is regularly dismissed. If the child[ren] [is/are] not in school, [name] shall pick up the child[ren] at the residence of [name] at 6:00 P.M., and [name] is ORDERED to surrender [names] to [name] at the residence of [name] at 6:00 P.M. under these circumstances.]*

Return of [names] by [name] - [name] is ORDERED to return [names] to the residence of [name] at the end of each period of possession. However, it is ORDERED that, if [name] and [name] live in the same county at the time of rendition of this order, [name]'s county of residence remains the same after the rendition of this order, and [name]'s county of residence changes, effective on the date of the change of residence by [name], [name] shall surrender [names] to [name] at the residence of [name] at the end of each period of possession.

If a period of possession by [name] ends at the time [names]'s school resumes, [name] is ORDERED to surrender [names] to [name] at the end of each period of possession at the school in which the child[ren] [is/are] enrolled, and [name] is ORDERED to deliver [names] to the child[ren]'s school on or before the time the child[ren]'s school day regularly begins, or, if the child[ren] [is/are] not in school, [name]
is ORDERED to surrender [names] to [name] at the residence of [name] at the end of each period of possession.

Return of [names] by [name] - [name] is ORDERED to return [names] to the residence of [name] at the end of each period of possession. However, it is ORDERED that, if [name] and [name] live in the same county at the time of rendition of this order, [name]'s county of residence remains the same after the rendition of this order, and [name]'s county of residence changes, effective on the date of the change of residence by [name], [name] shall surrender [names] to [name] at the residence of [name] at the end of each period of possession.

If a period of possession by [name] ends at the time [names]'s school resumes, [name] is ORDERED to surrender [names] to [name] at the end of each period of possession at the school in which the child[ren] [is/are] enrolled, and [name] is ORDERED to deliver [names] to the child[ren]'s school on or before the time the child[ren]'s school day regularly begins, or, if the child[ren] [is/are] not in school, [name] is ORDERED to surrender [names] to [name] at the residence of [name] at the end of each period of possession.

Surrender of [names] by [name] - [name] is ORDERED to surrender [names] to [name], if the child[ren] [is/are] in [name]'s possession or subject to [name]'s control, at the beginning of each period of [name]'s exclusive periods of possession, at the place designated in this order.

Surrender of [names] by [name] - [name] is ORDERED to surrender [names] to [name], if the child[ren] [is/are] in [name]'s possession or subject to [name]'s control, at the beginning of each period of [name]'s exclusive periods of possession, at the place designated in this order.

Return of [names] by [name] - [name] is ORDERED to return [names] to [name], if [name] is entitled to possession of [names], at the end of each of [name]'s exclusive periods of possession, at the place designated in this order.

Return of [names] by [name] - [name] is ORDERED to return [names] to [name], if [name] is entitled to possession of [names], at the end of each of [name]'s exclusive periods of possession, at the place designated in this order.
Personal Effects - Each [parent/conservator] is ORDERED to return with a child the personal effects that the child brought at the beginning of the period of possession.

Designation of Competent Adult - Each [parent/conservator] may designate any competent adult to pick up and return a child, as applicable. IT IS ORDERED that a [parent/conservator] or a designated competent adult be present when a child is picked up or returned.

Inability to Exercise Possession - Each [parent/conservator] is ORDERED to give notice to the other [parent/conservator] in possession of a child on each occasion that the [parent/conservator] will be unable to exercise that [parent/conservator]'s right of possession for any specified period. Repeated failure of a [parent/conservator] to give notice of an inability to exercise possessory rights may be considered as a factor in a modification of those possessory rights.

Written Notice - Written notice, including notice provided by electronic mail or facsimile or as otherwise authorized in this [decree/order], shall be deemed to have been timely made if received or, if applicable, postmarked before or at the time that notice is due. Each conservator is ORDERED to notify the other conservator of any change in the conservator's electronic mail address or facsimile number within twenty-four hours after the change.

Notice to School and Other Conservator - If a conservator's time of possession of a child ends at the time school resumes and for any reason the child is not or will not be returned to school, the conservator in possession of the child shall immediately notify the school and the other conservator that the child will not be or has not been returned to school.

Duration
The periods of possession ordered above apply to [the/each] child the subject of this suit while that child is under the age of eighteen years and not otherwise emancipated.
Noninterference with Possession

Except as expressly provided herein, IT IS ORDERED that neither conservator shall take possession of the child[ren] during the other conservator's period of possession unless there is a prior written agreement signed by both conservators or in case of an emergency.

For purposes of this order, the term "electronic communication" means any communication facilitated by the use of any wired or wireless technology via the Internet or any other electronic media. The term includes communication facilitated by the use of a telephone, electronic mail, instant messaging, videoconferencing, or webcam.
